title: Are planet Earth's geological processes still creating minerals, petroleum, and natural gas every day? - Quora

response.answer_text: This sounds like a homework question to me! Think about this: are Earth’s geologic processes still going on? Has anything changed that would have stopped the formation of those things? —Bonnie HS Science teacher

Natural gas Methane yes. Petroleum takes many eons and special conditions to form. I suppose that there may be some of this still occurring. As for minerals such as iron, copper, lead, etc. No these do not “regenerate”
Certainly. The real question is “At what rate?” I’m sure it’s a tiny fraction of the current 100 million bpd worldwide production/consumption.
